page.title: 03CRAWSHAWBOOTH C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: Crawshawbooth County Primary School is situated on the main Rawtenstall to Burnley road (A56), between Crawshawbooth and Loveclough. The school building is semi-open plan with separate playgrounds for junior and infant children, a large playing field and an open outlook to the rear. The school has 307 children on role, split into 10 junior and infant classes. There are 12 full-time and 2 part-time teaching staff. The number of children at the school is increasing due to recently developed housing estates at Loveclough and Reedsholme, catering for many families with children of primary school age. School begins at 9.00 a.m. and ends at 3.30 p.m., with a 20 minute morning break and 75 minutes lunch break. School meals are prepared on the premises for those who require them.
